page.title: 11Farming In Davenham
page.content: Eaton House Farm has 250 acres and rents 150 acres from Lord Delamere and has 200 Friesian cows which do not milk, uses Beeston-Smithfield market for buying and selling. His fields are used for many crop industry and silage - winter food barley for cattle food and the brewery. 50 acres are for potatoes, 50 acres for oil seed rape which goes to Bibby's Liverpool for cooking oil. The majority of the potatoes go to Manchester and Liverpool market. He rotates 1-2 years and owns and uses a lot of machinery. He employs 2 men, 1 works full-time and one part-time they work for farm labour. He has 5 barns for storing potatoes, cattle silage and machinery.
